intro: Peponidium horridum, commonly known as the spiny cucumber, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes other cucurbits like pumpkins and gourds. The plant is characterized by its rough, spiny stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a large, green, spiky gourd that can grow up to 1 meter in length.
